intro: Erica banksia subsp. comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's banksia, is a shrub native to southwestern Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and distinctive, cone-like inflorescences. The plant produces yellow flowers that are highly attractive to nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
